paper_abstract: We show that if SAT does not have small circuits, then there must exist a small number of satisfiable formulas such that every small circuit fails to compute satisfiability correctly on at least one of these formulas. We use this result to show that if p(NP[1]) = p(NP[2]), then the polynomial-time hierarchy collapses to S-2(P) subset of Sigma(P)(2) boolean AND Pi(P)(2). Even showing that the hierarchy collapsed to Sigma(P)(2) remained open prior to this paper. (c) 2007 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Proving SAT does not have small circuits with an application to the two queries problem
